info.name: mode
info.description: This is the primary task of the monitor.

possible.name: Disabled
possible.info: Inactive monitor, no process will be created in this mode.

possible.name: Watch-Only
possible.info: Monitor will only stream, no recording will occur unless otherwise ordered by API or Detector.

possible.name: Record
possible.info: Continuous Recording. Segments are made every 15 minutes by default.

info.name: mid
info.description: This is a non-changeable identifier for the monitor. You can duplicate a monitor by double clicking the Monitor ID and changing it.

info.name: name
info.description: This is the human-readable display name for the monitor.

info.name: detail=fatal_max
info.description: The number of times to retry for network connection between the server and camera before setting the monitor to Disabled. No decimals. Set to 0 to retry forever.

info.name: detail=notes
info.description: Comments you want to leave for this camera.

info.name: detail=dir
info.description: Location of where recorded files will be saved. You can configure more locations with the addStorage variable.

info.name: type
info.description: The method that will used to consume the video stream.

possible.name: JPEG
possible.info: Reading snapshots from a URL and making a stream and/or video from them.

possible.name: MJPEG
possible.info: Similar to JPEG except the frame handling is done by FFMPEG, not Shinobi.

possible.name: H.264
possible.info: Reading a high quality video streas that sometimes include audio.

possible.name: Local
possible.info: Reading Capture Cards, Webcams, or Integrated Cameras.

possible.name: Shinobi Streamer
possible.info: Continuous Recording. Segments are made every 15 minutes by default.

info.name: detail=auto_host_enable
info.description: Feed the individual pieces required to build a stream URL or provide the full URL and allow Shinobi to parse it for you.

info.name: detail=auto_host
info.description: The full Stream URL.

info.name: detail=accelerator
info.description: Hardware Acceleration (HWAccel) for decoding streams.

info.name: protocol
info.description: The protocol that will used to consume the video stream.

info.name: detail=muser
info.description: The user login for your camera

info.name: detail=mpass
info.description: The password for your camera

info.name: host
info.description: Connection address

info.name: port
info.description: Port number that your camera is streaming out on.

info.name: detail=port_force
info.description: Using the default web port can allow automatic switch to other ports for streams like RTSP.

info.name: path
info.description: The path to your camera

info.name: detail=aduration
info.description: Specify how many microseconds are analyzed to probe the input. Set to 100000 if you are using RTSP and having stream issues.

info.name: detail=probesize
info.description: Specify how big to make the analyzation probe for the input. Set to 100000 if you are using RTSP and having stream issues.

info.name: detail=rtsp_transport
info.description: The transport protocol your camera will use. TCP is usually the best choice.

possible.name: Auto
possible.info: Let FFMPEG decide. Normally it will try UDP first.

possible.name: TCP
possible.info: Set it to this if UDP starts giving undesired results.

info.name: detail=stream_type
info.description: The method that will used to consume the video stream.

possible.name: MJPEG
possible.info: Standard Motion JPEG image. No audio.

possible.name: HLS
possible.info: Similar method to facebook live streams. Includes audio if input provides it. There is a delay of about 4-6 seconds because this method records segments then pushes them to the client rather than push as while it creates them.

possible.name: Base64
possible.info: Sending Base64 encoded frames over WebSocket. This avoids caching but there is no audio.

possible.name: FLV
possible.info: Sending FLV encoded frames over WebSocket.

possible.name: kVid
possible.info: Using Kevin Godell's custom JavaScript MP4 segmenting engine.

info.name: detail=signal_check
info.description: How often your client will check each stream to see if it is alive. This is calculated in minutes.

info.name: detail=stream_flv_type
info.description: The method you will view your FLV stream. Both methods are always active for each stream regardless of your viewing choice for the Shinobi Dashboard.

info.name: detail=signal_check_log
info.description: This is for the client side only. It will display in the log thread when client side signal checks occur.

possible.name: Yes
possible.info: Check signal based on the number of minutes provided.

info.name: detail=stream_quality
info.description: Low number means higher quality. Higher number means less quality.

info.name: detail=stream_fps
info.description: The speed in which frames are displayed to clients, in Frames Per Second. Be aware there is no default. This can lead to high bandwidth usage.

info.name: height
info.description: Height of the stream image.

info.name: width
info.description: Width of the stream image.

info.name: detail=svf
info.description: Place FFMPEG video filters in this box to affect the streaming portion. No spaces.

info.name: detail=stream_vcodec
info.description: Video codec for streaming.

possible.name: copy
possible.info: Used for MP4 video. Has very low CPU usage but cannot use video filters and filesizes may be gigantic.  Best to setup your MP4 settings camera-side when using this option.

info.name: detail=stream_acodec
info.description: Audio codec for streaming.

possible.name: No Audio
possible.info: No Audio, this is an option that must be set in some parts of the world due to legal reasons.

possible.name: copy
possible.info: Used for MP4 video. Has very low CPU usage but some audio codecs need custom flags like -strict 2 for aac.

info.name: detail=hls_time
info.description: How long each video segment should be, in minutes. Each segment will be drawn by the client through an m3u8 file. Shorter segments take less space.

info.name: detail=hls_list_size
info.description: The number of segments maximum before deleting old segments automatically.

info.name: detail=preset_stream
info.description: Preset flag for certain video encoders. If you find your camera is crashing every few seconds : try leaving it blank.

info.name: detail=stream_scale_x
info.description: Width of the stream image.

info.name: detail=stream_scale_y
info.description: Height of the stream image.

info.name: detail=tv_channel
info.description: This monitor will have TV Channel features enabled. You will be able to view it in your TV Channel list.

info.name: detail=tv_channel_id
info.description: A Custom ID for the Channel.

info.name: ext
info.description: The file type for your recorded video file.

possible.name: MP4
possible.info: This file type is playable is almost all modern web browsers, that includes mobile. The filesize just tends to be larger unless you lower the quality.

possible.name: WebM
possible.info: Small filesize, low client compatibility. Good for uploading to sites like YouTube.

info.name: detail=vcodec
info.description: Video codec for recording.

possible.name: copy
possible.info: Used for MP4 video. Has very low CPU usage but cannot use video filters and filesizes may be gigantic.  Best to setup your MP4 settings camera-side when using this option.

info.name: detail=acodec
info.description: Audio codec for recording.

possible.name: No Audio
possible.info: No Audio, this is an option that must be set in some parts of the world due to legal reasons.

possible.name: copy
possible.info: Used for MP4 video. Has very low CPU usage but some audio codecs need custom flags like -strict 2 for aac.

info.name: crf
info.description: Low number means higher quality. Higher number means less quality.

info.name: preset_record
info.description: Preset flag for certain video encoders. If you find your camera is crashing every few seconds : try leaving it blank.

info.name: fps
info.description: The speed in which frames are recorded to files, Frames Per Second. Be aware there is no default. This can lead to large files. Best to set this camera-side.

info.name: height
info.description: Height of the stream image.

info.name: width
info.description: Width of the stream image.

info.name: detail=cutoff
info.description: In minutes. When to slice off and start a new video file.

info.name: detail=dqf
info.description: Some directories have spaces depending on how you setup your OS.

possible.name: Yes
possible.info: Using this may crash some cameras.

info.name: detail=vf
info.description: Place FFMPEG video filters in this box to affect the recording portion. No spaces.

info.name: detail=timestamp_font
info.description: Font File to style your timestamp.

info.name: detail=timestamp_font_size
info.description: Font size in pt.

info.name: detail=timestamp_color
info.description: Timstamp text color.

info.name: detail=timestamp_box_color
info.description: Timstamp backdrop color.

info.name: detail=timestamp_x
info.description: Horiztonal Position of Timestamp

info.name: detail=timestamp_y
info.description: Vertical Position of Timestamp

info.name: detail=detector
info.description: This will add another output in the FFMPEG command for the motion detector. A detector plugin must be connected for this to have any effect.

info.name: detail=detector_pam
info.description: Use Kevin Godell's Motion Detector. This is built into Shinobi and requires no other configuration to activate.

info.name: detail=detector_trigger
info.description: This will order the camera to record if it is set to "Watch-Only" when a motion even is detected.

info.name: detail=detector_timeout
info.description: The length of time "Trigger Record" will run for. This is read in minutes.

info.name: detail=watchdog_reset
info.description: If there is an overlap in trigger record should it reset.

info.name: detail=detector_save
info.description: Save Motion Events in SQL. This will allow display of motion over video during the time motion events occured in the Power Viewer.

info.name: detail=detector_send_frames
info.description: Push frames to the connected plugin to be analyzed.

info.name: detail=detector_frame_save
info.description: Save frames to the event row in the database as a base64 string. Enabling this can drain performance.

info.name: detail=detector_mail
info.description: Recieve an email of an image during a motion event to the master account for the camera group. You must setup SMTP details in conf.json.

info.name: detail=detector_mail_timeout
info.description: The amount of time until a trigger is allowed to send another email with motion details and another image.

info.name: detail=detector_fps
info.description: How many frames a second to send to the motion detector; 1 is the default.

info.name: detail=detector_scale_x
info.description: Width of the image being detected. Smaller sizes take less CPU.

info.name: detail=detector_scale_y
info.description: Height of the image being detected. Smaller sizes take less CPU.

info.name: detail=detector_frame
info.description: This will read the entire frame for pixel differences.

possible.name: No
possible.info: Makes motion detector do nothing if regions are not specified. Which is a stupid option to have if motion detection is on. One day we will remove this option.

info.name: detail=detector_sensitivity
info.description: How much Shinobi doesn't care about motion before doing something. The opposite of sensitivity; a lower number means it will trigger sooner. The value ranges up to 15(+) decimal places.  10 is default, 0.005 is pretty sensitive to motion changes.  Note: If using Region Editor, leave this blank, and set indifference in the Region Editor (below).

info.name: detail=detector_webhook
info.description: Send a GET request to a URL with some values from the event.

info.name: detail=detector_command_enable
info.description: You may use this to trigger a script on command.

possible.name: Yes
possible.info: Trigger the script that is set in the Command option. Command is only visible when selecting this option.

info.name: detail=detector_command
info.description: The command that will run. This is the equivalent of running a shell command from terminal.

info.name: detail=detector_command_timeout
info.description: This value is a timer to allow the next running of your script. This value is in minutes.

info.name: detail=detector_notrigger_mail
info.description: If motion has not been detected after the timeout period you will recieve an email.

info.name: detail=detector_notrigger_timeout
info.description: Timeout is calculated in minutes.

info.name: detail=cust_input
info.description: Custom Flags that bind to the Input of the FFMPEG process.

info.name: detail=cust_snap
info.description: Custom Flags that bind to the Snapshots.

info.name: detail=cust_detect
info.description: Custom Flags that bind to the stream Detector uses for analyzation.

info.name: detail=cust_stream
info.description: Custom Flags that bind to the Stream (client side view) of the FFMPEG process.

info.name: detail=cust_record
info.description: Custom Flags that bind to the recording of the FFMPEG process.

info.name: detail=custom_output
info.description: Add a custom output like JPEG frames or send data straight to another server.

info.name: detail=loglevel
info.description: The amount of data to provide while doing the job.

possible.name: Silent
possible.info: None. This will silence all logging.

possible.name: On Error
possible.info: Display all important errors. Note : this doesn't always show important information.

possible.name: All Warnings
possible.info: Display all warnings. Use this if you can't find out what's wrong with your camera.

possible.name: Debug
possible.info: Show all information FFMPEG can provide on STDERR while doing the job.

info.name: detail=sqllog
info.description: Use this with caution as FFMPEG likes to throw up superfluous data at times which can lead to a lot of database rows.

possible.name: Yes
possible.info: Do this if you are having recurring issues only.

info.name: mail
info.description: The login for accounts. The main account holder's email address will get notifications.

info.name: pass
info.description: Leave blank to keep the same password during settings modification.

info.name: detail=size
info.description: The amount max space Shinobi will allow to be consumed before purging. This value is read in megabytes.
info.possible: Up to 95% of your maximum storage space if only one master account exists.

info.name: detail=days
info.field: Number of Days to keep Videos
info.description: The number of days to keep videos before purging.

info.name: detail=event_days
info.field: Number of Days to keep Events
info.description: The number of days to keep events before purging.

info.name: detail=log_days
info.field: Number of Days to keep Logs
info.description: The number of days to keep logs before purging.
The list of groups you have created.
Name of selected group.

info.name: detail=webdav_url
info.description: The connection URL for your WebDAV server.

info.name: detail=webdav_user
info.description: The username required to access this server.

info.name: detail=webdav_pass
info.description: The password required to access this server.

info.name: detail=webdav_save
info.description: Whether or not the server should auto upload videos as they are finished.

info.name: detail=webdav_dir
info.description: The directory where videos will be saved.

info.name: detail=css
info.description: Add custom colors to your dashboard. This field should only be used by advanced users.
